starvationevasion.common.gamecards

Class Policy_EfficientIrrigationIncentive

  • java.lang.Object
    • starvationevasion.common.gamecards.GameCard
      • starvationevasion.common.gamecards.Policy_EfficientIrrigationIncentive
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, JSON, Sendable

    public class Policy_EfficientIrrigationIncentive
extends GameCard
    Title: "Efficient Irrigation Incentive"

    Game Text: "From now through the start of the next turn, X% of money spent by farmers in player\'s region for improved irrigation efficiency is tax deductible."

    Flavor Text: "Maybe this\'ll get them to stop using lawn sprinklers for watering 100 acres of soy."

    Draft Affects: When drafting this policy, player selects a percentage X [10%, 25%, or 50%].

    Votes Required: Automatic

    Model Effects: The sim estimates the number and location of farms within the region and the amount spent by those farms on improved irrigation. The model will need a current distribution of irrigation efficiency levels, the four control points of an ease-in-out cubic Bezier function giving efficiency increase as a function of dollars spent and a distribution of current water sources being used by farms.

    Depending on the region and the area within the region, the effects of lower water usage might include a permanent (through endgame) reduction of farming costs, aquifer depletion, and/or river flow depletion. Increased irrigation efficiency also reduces pesticides, fertilizer, and turbidity levels in outflowing rivers.

    X% of the money that the sim estimates is spent for improved irrigation is deducted from the regions tax revenue at the start of the next turn.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getFlavorText

        public java.lang.String getFlavorText()
        In the abstract GameCard class, this method returns the default flavor text of a card. Initially, this String is null, but any card that will have flavor text will override this method to return the selected String of text.

        Note: Not every card is guaranteed to have flavor text, so this may return null.

        Overrides:
        getFlavorText in class GameCard
